abstract.text: A request to the App Store to get the app receipt, which represents the customer’s transactions with your app.

inlineContent.text: Use Transaction.all and AppTransaction.shared

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The receipt isn’t necessary if you use
to validate the app download, or
to validate in-app purchases. Only use the receipt if your app uses the
, or needs the receipt to validate the app download because it can’t use
Use this API to request a new app receipt from the App Store if the receipt is invalid or missing from its expected location,
. To request the receipt using the
object, you initialize it, attach a
, and then call the request’s
method.

The receipt refresh request displays a system prompt that asks users to authenticate with their App Store credentials. For a better user experience, initiate the request after an explicit user action, like tapping or clicking a button.
When the request completes successfully, your delegate receives an
object in its
method. Locate the app receipt using the
property. For information about validating the receipt, see
If the request fails and calls your delegate’s

method, your app needs to release the request and not attempt to call it a second time. Requests can fail when a user doesn’t authenticate or chooses to cancel the request. Without a validated receipt, assume the user doesn’t have access to premium content.
In the sandbox environment, you can initialize a receipt with any combination of properties for testing when you call
There are times when using
isn’t necessary, so avoid doing so, such as in the following scenarios:
If the receipt is valid, but may be missing transactions, use
instead. For example, the receipt may be missing a transaction if a person purchases a new subscription on another device.
In the sandbox environment, before the tester completes their first in-app purchase. Receipts are initially absent in the sandbox environment for iOS and iPadOS apps. For more information, see

abstract.text: The file URL for the bundle’s App Store receipt.
Support In-App Purchases and interactions with the App Store.
Information that represents the customer’s purchase of the app, cryptographically signed by the App Store.
Asks the payment queue to restore previously completed purchases.
A key with a value that indicates whether the receipt is in an expired state.
A key with a value that indicates whether the receipt is in a revoked state.
A key with a value that indicates whether the receipt is a Volume Purchase Plan receipt.
A request to the App Store to get the app receipt, which represents the customer’s transactions with your app.
Creates a receipt refresh request with optional properties.
The properties of the receipt.
An abstract class that represents a request to the App Store.
The delegate of the request object.
Sends the request to the Apple App Store.
Tells the delegate that the request failed to execute.
Tells the delegate that the request has completed.
Information that represents the customer’s purchase of a product in your app.
Select the type of receipt validation, on the device or on your server, that works for your app.
Offer additional content and services in your app using the Original In-App Purchase API.
Give customers functionality that restores their purchases in your app to maintain access to purchased content.
Verify transactions with the App Store on a secure server.

doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/S.title: Validating receipts with the App Store

abstract.text: The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.

inlineContent.text: Use Transaction.all and AppTransaction.shared
